content: The Eiffel Tower was designed by French engineer Gustave Eiffel and his team of collaborators for the 1889 World's Fair in Paris. The inspiration for the design came from two sources: the need to create a daring and original centerpiece for the exhibition, and a desire to showcase the latest advances in iron construction technology. Eiffel was a pioneer in this field, having designed several notable bridges and viaducts prior to taking on the tower project.
